bob.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to move up and down when floating on the surface of water
bob.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The boat bobbed gently up and down on the water.
bob.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to move quickly in a particular direction
bob.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Mrs Foster bobbed about, gathering up her things.
bob.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to cut someone’s, especially a woman’s, hair in a bob
bob.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: a way of cutting hair so that it hangs to the level of your chin and is the same length all the way round your head
bob.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a quick up and down movement of your head or body, to show respect, agreement, greeting etc
bob.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The maid gave a little bob and left the room.
bob.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: a shilling (=coin used in the past in Britain)
bob.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: At last I’m making a few bob  (=a reasonable amount of money).
